text: Hey <@U25C65C3S> are you trying to separate the <title> tag from the post header on the blog post/listing page? If so,  I have been able to do this using a text HubL module (<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-modules#text>) in the post and listing template sections. For the post template, I replaced <h1>{{ content.name }}</h1> with the text module and exported that value to template and then called that value: <h1>{% text "blogHeader" label="Blog Post Header", no_wrapper=True, export_to_template_context=True  %}{{ widget_data.blogHeadervalue }}</h1> then in the listing page I replaced {{ content.name }} with {{ content.widgets.blogHeader.body.value }}
<@U26AKMZ19>: I got that far. The title tag (seo) is what I'm stuck with

Oh okay I think I got it, so you're trying to have a separate HubL module for the actual title tag itself. Any reason you want it to be different from where the title is currently set in the settings tab?
The 'titles' are more internal for editing in the HubSpot blog tool.

Got it, to my knowledge I don't believe there is a way to replace the text in the title tag with a HubL module and still keep the title crawlable unless anyone else has any ideas that I may be missing.
